fr.pyvain.websight.websight.PersonalDataGraph

Class Drawing

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.pyvain.websight.websight.PersonalDataGraph.Drawing

  • public final class Drawing
extends java.lang.Object

    This class represents a drawing of a graph. It is defined by :

    • The centers of the graph's vertices.
    • The radius of the graph's vertices
    • The segments representing the graph's edges

    To make easier the actual drawing phase, it also contains the distance in pixel equivalent to 1 unit of distance in the base layout, and the radius of the vertices.

    Finally, it allows to compute which Vertex / Edge is at a given position

      Initializes a new drawing of the specified graph, using the specified radial layout, on a canvas of specified dimensions, placing the center of the layout at specified position, and using specified Vertex radius.

      • Drawing

        public Drawing(fr.pyvain.websight.websight.PersonalDataGraph.Graph g,
               RadialLayout l,
               float vRadius,
               int xMin,
               int yMin,
               int xMax,
               int yMax,
               int x0,
               int y0)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Initializes a new drawing of the specified graph, using the specified radial layout, on a canvas of specified dimensions, placing the center of the layout at specified position, and using specified Vertex radius.
        Parameters:
        g - Graph that must be drawn
        l - RadialLayout to be used
        vRadius - Vertex radius to be used, must be in ]0,layout's max vertex radius[
        xMin - left end x-coordinate of the canvas
        yMin - top end y-coordinate of the canvas
        xMax - right end x-coordinate of the canvas
        yMax - bottom end y-coordinate of the canvas
        x0 - x-coordinate of (0, 0) in the drawing
        y0 - y-coordinate of (0, 0) in the drawing
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the canvas dimension are invalid, the root is outside the canvas, or the vertex radius is out of bounds.

        l - RadialLayout to be used

        xMin - left end x-coordinate of the canvas
        yMin - top end y-coordinate of the canvas
        xMax - right end x-coordinate of the canvas
        yMax - bottom end y-coordinate of the canvas
        x0 - x-coordinate of (0, 0) in the drawing
        y0 - y-coordinate of (0, 0) in the drawing*
        Throws:

      • vertexAt

        public Vertex vertexAt(CPoint p,
                       int d)
        If there is a Vertex drawn within specified distance of the specified point, returns it. Else returns null.
        Parameters:
        p - CPoint to analyse
        d - radius of the area to analyse, must be >= 0
        Returns:
        The Vertex drawn in the specified area if it exists, null else

      • edgeAt

        public Edge edgeAt(CPoint p,
                   int d)
        If there is an Edge drawn within specified distance of the specified point, returns it. Else returns null.
        Parameters:
        p - CPoint to analyse
        d - radius of the area to analyse, must be > 0
        Returns:
        The Edge drawn in the specified area if it exists, null else

      • nbEdgeIntersections

        public int nbEdgeIntersections()
        Returns the number of intersection between the edges of the drawing. Undefined behaviour if one of the segments is outside [-1000, 1000] x [-1000, 1000] (caused by long overflow)
        Returns:
        the number of intersection between the edges of the layout

      • nbVertexCrossings

        public int nbVertexCrossings(java.util.Collection<Edge> edges)
        Returns the number of times the given set of edges cross Vertices in the drawing. Undefined behaviour if one of the segments is outside [-1000, 1000] x [-1000, 1000] (caused by long overflow)
        Parameters:
        edges - The set of edges to compute the intersection with the vertices of the drawing
        Returns:
        the number of times vertices cross edges in the layout
